Microbiology.without_watermark:
A. a substance that stimulates the immune system to produce antibodies against a specific pathogen
B. a substance that stimulates the immune system to produce antibodies against a specific pathogen
C. a substance that stimulates the immune system to produce antibodies against a specific pathogen
D. a substance that stimulates the immune system to produce antibodies against a specific pathogen
E. a substance that stimulates the immune system to produce antibodies against a specific pathogen
Answers:
Microbiology.with_watermark: A substance, usually a toxin or other foreign substance, which when introduced into the body, induces the body to make antibodies against the foreign substance.
